javelin.controller.action

Class Target

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.action.Action
      • javelin.controller.action.Target
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ActionDescription
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Fire

    public abstract class Target
extends Action
    Base class for all actions involving selecting an unit as target.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        protected abstract int calculatehitdc(Combatant target,
                                      Combatant active,
                                      BattleState state)
        Returns:
        Minimum number the active combatant has to roll on a d20 to hit the target.

      • perform

        public boolean perform(Combatant c,
                       BattleMap map,
                       tyrant.mikera.engine.Thing thing)
        Description copied from class: Action
        Performs an action as the human player.
        Specified by:
        perform in class Action
        Parameters:
        c - Current unit.
        map - Current map.
        thing - Unit's visual representation.
        Returns:
        true if executed an action (successfully or not). Just return false if the player cannot use this action (AI-only).

      • checkengaged

        protected boolean checkengaged(BattleState state,
                               Combatant c)
        By default uses BattleState.isengaged(Combatant)
        Returns:
        true if the active unit is currently engaded and should not be allowed to continue targetting.

      • filtertargets

        protected void filtertargets(Combatant active,
                             java.util.List<Combatant> targets,
                             BattleState s)
        By default only allows targeting enemies that are in line-of-sight.
        Parameters:
        targets - Remove invalid targets from this list. Beware of ConcurrentModificationException.
